Articles.Content:
I'd like to be able to design maneuvers for long-term (years) missions, and then switch to doing other missions in the meantime.
KSP should raise an alarm when the planned maneuvers are coming up in the next few days or so.

"Your mission XYZ is about to have a maneuver in T-XdXhXm, would you like to switch to that view? [switch] [snooze]"

Thanks.
The mod Kerbal Alarm [url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24786-1-0-x-Kerbal-Alarm-Clock-v3-4-0-0-(June-27)[/url] clock does exactly that. Many people would like to see it become stock
This is one of the many things this game needs before it can actually be used to run a fictional space PROGRAM, instead of just being used to run individual space missions in sequence.
Yes, please. Also alarms when there are low dV transfer windows for other planets.

I'd say at a minimum the initial suggestion plus a way for mods to add additional alarms is needed.
A nice list somewhere of future alarms sorted in order would also be good.
Anything beyond that would be a bonus.

A simple KAC in stock would be amazing. KAC is a very powerful, and complex, tool though. I'm thinking of a (mod expandable) simple alarm clock, something like:

[list][*]"Stopwatch" icon in toolbar, lists all events set when clicked.
[*]Maneuver nodes are automatically added to the alarms with the alarm being something like (NodeTime - 5 minutes).
[*]Clicking the button also allows you to add a MET-specific alarm that you can custom name.[/list]


Nothing super complex for the first iteration in stock. Having automatic alerts of Maneuver nodes would be the main feature, and being able to set custom alerts can be used for everything else (landed craft, etc.)
Yeah we definitely need this. It could be linked to Tracking station upgrades to give you transfer window alarms as well.

I think for KSP to be a good kerbal space program, some form of Kerbal alarm clock is definately needed.

In another thread on the forum Snark mentioned this idea: [URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/137206-Add-Maneuvers-tab-to-tracking-station[/URL] Edited November 19, 2015 by nikokespprfan
